question: Match the following oviduct and uterus terms with their NCERT-based descriptions:
column_II: Funnel-shaped part of oviduct closer to the ovary
Finger-like projections which help in collection of the ovum

matches.right: Funnel-shaped part of oviduct closer to the ovary
Finger-like projections which help in collection of the ovum

answer: 1-A: Oviducts (fallopian tubes), uterus and vagina → Female accessory ducts
2-B: Each fallopian tube length → About 10-12 cm long
3-C: Infundibulum → Funnel-shaped part of oviduct closer to the ovary
4-D: Fimbriae → Finger-like projections which help in collection of the ovum

question: Match the following ampulla, isthmus and uterus terms with NCERT-based descriptions:
column_II: Last part of oviduct with narrow lumen

matches.right: Last part of oviduct with narrow lumen

answer: 1-A: Ampulla → Wider part of the oviduct
2-B: Isthmus → Last part of oviduct with narrow lumen
4-D: Shape of uterus → Like an inverted pear

question: Match the following cervix, canal and uterine layers with NCERT-based descriptions:
column_II: Narrow opening of uterus into vagina
External thin membranous layer of uterus
Middle thick layer of smooth muscle in uterus

matches.right: Narrow opening of uterus into vagina
External thin membranous layer of uterus
Middle thick layer of smooth muscle in uterus

answer: 1-A: Cervix → Narrow opening of uterus into vagina
2-B: Cervical canal and vagina → Forms the birth canal
3-C: Perimetrium → External thin membranous layer of uterus
4-D: Myometrium → Middle thick layer of smooth muscle in uterus

question: Match the following endometrium and uterine function terms with NCERT-based descriptions:
column_II: Undergoes cyclical changes during menstrual cycle
Exhibits strong contraction during delivery of the baby
Supported by ligaments attached to the pelvic wall

matches.right: Undergoes cyclical changes during menstrual cycle
Exhibits strong contraction during delivery of the baby
Supported by ligaments attached to the pelvic wall

answer: 2-B: Function of endometrium → Undergoes cyclical changes during menstrual cycle
3-C: Function of myometrium → Exhibits strong contraction during delivery of the baby
4-D: Support of uterus → Supported by ligaments attached to the pelvic wall
